text: Oh Laurie how lovely it isn't what it
should be but you have improved it
please don't I like to much better when
you were blunt natural did not serve me
well I find you changed in fact I
despise you you laze about spending your
family's money in courting women you
want serious about music my compositions
are like your paintings mediocre copies
of another man's genius and why don't
you go to grandfather in London and make
yourself useful I should
why don't you reform me some more
practical
do not love Fred Vaughn stable and
well-mannered as 40,000 a year I've
always known I would not marry a pop I
expect a proposal any day all regretted
I'll regret it
I'm reminded of a promise didn't I say I
would kiss you before you die do you
hear from Joe
she has befriended a German professor
yes well no doubt he's showing her the
ways of the world I do not wish to be
courted by someone who is still in love
with my sister I'm not in love with Joe
then how do you explain your jealousy I
envy her happiness I envy his happiness
I envy John Brook for marrying Meg hate
Fred Vaughan and if Beth had a lover I
would despise him too just as you have
always known you would never marry a
pauper I have always known I should be
part of the March family I do not wish
to be loved for my family any more than
Fred Vaughan wishes to be loved for his
forty thousand a year
[Music]
